== Live USB ==
== Live USB ==
There is also a Windows tool called [http://hacktolive.org/cd2usb cd2usb] to create [[Ubuntu]] and ''Super OS'' [[Live USB]]s. The program is already included in the DVD of ''Super OS''.<ref>[http://hacktolive.org/blog/2009/super-os-9-04-the-new-super-ubuntu-is-now-out/ hacktolive.org/blog/2009/super-os-9-04-the-new-super-ubuntu-is-now-out/]</ref>
There is also a Windows tool called [http://hacktolive.org/cd2usb cd2usb] to create [[Ubuntu]] and ''Super OS'' [[Live USB]]s. The program is already included in the DVD of ''Super OS''.<ref>[http://hacktolive.org/blog/2009/super-os-9-04-the-new-super-ubuntu-is-now-out/ hacktolive.org/blog/2009/super-os-9-04-the-new-super-ubuntu-is-now-out/]</ref>
  +   +
==Software repository==
  +
In addition to the Ubuntu repositorires, Super OS also includes it's own repositories, which include software third-party software like [[Adobe Reader]], [[Skype]], [[Real Player]], or [[Google Chrome]], but also include tools/software developed by ''hacktolive'', like App Runner and RUNZ.
